meanings.definition: To walk or travel on snowshoes.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I snowshoed through the snowy forest.
meanings.sent2: She snowshoed across the frozen lake to reach the other side.
meanings.sent3: The penguin snowshoed gracefully on the icy terrain.
meanings.sent4: His determination snowshoed him to the mountain peak.
meanings.sent5: The adventurer snowshoed through the blizzard, undeterred by the cold.

meanings.sent1: Last winter, we snowshoed in the mountains.
meanings.sent2: They snowshoed to the cabin and enjoyed hot cocoa.
meanings.sent3: The cat snowshoed around the house, leaving tiny prints in the snow.
meanings.sent4: The memories of their snowshoed adventures lingered in their minds.
meanings.sent5: The old man proudly snowshoed in his youth, reminiscing about the past.
